Key Match Events: New Zealand won the toss and elected to bat first.
New Zealand have made it to the T20 World Cup semifinal level four times, but haven’t won the trophy.
New Zealand ended as the runners-up in the last edition in 2021.
New Zealand defeated the reigning champions Australia in the league matches.
Pakistan performed well against Netherlands and South Africa in the Super 12 Group 2.
South Africa's shock defeat against the Netherlands helped Pakistan qualify at the last moment to the semifinals.
Pakistan skipper Babar Azam has been criticised for scoring just 39 runs in 5 games.
Pre-Game Insights: Experts predicted that the first batting team will have an advantage over the opponents.
In the last 6 matches in this tournament at the Sydney Cricket Ground, five times the team batting first has bested the team chasing.
As per ICC records, Pakistan and New Zealand have faced each other thrice in World Cup semis in different formats.
Pakistan’s performance will depend on the top order batsmen, including innings opener Mohammad Rizwan.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The weather in Sydney on Wednesday, November 9, could be partly cloudy with a slight chance of a shower in the morning.
Humidity will remain high during the match, with it being 62 per cent at the start and rising up to 73 per cent by 11 PM.
The temperature at the beginning of the first semi-final will be around 19-degree celsius and is expected to go down as the game progresses.
